trans-unit.source: ms.ContentId: 1ab7bfe1-da35-4ff1-916f-936fedf536a0 title: Setup Windows Containers in Azure
trans-unit.target: ms.ContentId: 1ab7bfe1-da35-4ff1-916f-936fedf536a0 title: Setup Windows Containers in Azure

trans-unit.source: Preparing Microsoft Azure for Windows Server Containers
trans-unit.target: Preparing Microsoft Azure for Windows Server Containers

trans-unit.source: Before creating and managing Windows Server Containers in Azure you will need to deploy a Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview image which has been pre-configured with the Windows Server Containers feature.
trans-unit.target: Before creating and managing Windows Server Containers in Azure you will need to deploy a Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview image which has been pre-configured with the Windows Server Containers feature.

trans-unit.source: This guide will walk you through this process.
trans-unit.target: This guide will walk you through this process.

trans-unit.source: Other getting started guides:
trans-unit.target: Other getting started guides:

trans-unit.source: Run Windows Server Containers in
trans-unit.target: Run Windows Server Containers in

trans-unit.source: a new Hyper-V virtual machine
trans-unit.target: a new Hyper-V virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Run Windows Server Containers in
trans-unit.target: Run Windows Server Containers in

trans-unit.source: an existing virtual machine
trans-unit.target: an existing virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Setup Windows Server Containers
trans-unit.target: Setup Windows Server Containers

trans-unit.source: on a physical Windows Server Core installation
trans-unit.target: on a physical Windows Server Core installation

trans-unit.source: Start Using Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Start Using Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: If you have an Azure account, skip straight to
trans-unit.target: If you have an Azure account, skip straight to

trans-unit.source: Create a Container Host VM
trans-unit.target: Create a Container Host VM

trans-unit.source: Go to
trans-unit.target: Go to

trans-unit.source: azure.com
trans-unit.target: azure.com

trans-unit.source: and follow the steps for an
trans-unit.target: and follow the steps for an

trans-unit.source: Azure Free Trial
trans-unit.target: Azure Free Trial

trans-unit.source: Sign in with your Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: Sign in with your Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: When your account is ready to go, sign into the
trans-unit.target: When your account is ready to go, sign into the

trans-unit.source: Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Create a Container Host VM
trans-unit.target: Create a Container Host VM

trans-unit.source: Click on the following link to start the VM creation process –
trans-unit.target: Click on the following link to start the VM creation process –

trans-unit.source: New Windows Server Container Host in Azure
trans-unit.target: New Windows Server Container Host in Azure

trans-unit.source: You can also search for the image in the Azure gallery.
trans-unit.target: You can also search for the image in the Azure gallery.

trans-unit.source: Click on the
trans-unit.target: Click on the

trans-unit.source: button.
trans-unit.target: button.

trans-unit.source: Give the Virtual Machine a name, select a user name and a password.
trans-unit.target: Give the Virtual Machine a name, select a user name and a password.

trans-unit.source: Select Optional Configuration > Endpoints > and enter an HTTP endpoint with a private and public port of 80 as seen below.
trans-unit.target: Select Optional Configuration > Endpoints > and enter an HTTP endpoint with a private and public port of 80 as seen below.

trans-unit.source: When completed click ok two times.
trans-unit.target: When completed click ok two times.

trans-unit.source: Select the
trans-unit.target: Select the

trans-unit.source: button to start the Virtual Machine deployment process.
trans-unit.target: button to start the Virtual Machine deployment process.

trans-unit.source: When the VM deployment is complete, select the connect button to start an RDP session with the Windows Server Container Host.
trans-unit.target: When the VM deployment is complete, select the connect button to start an RDP session with the Windows Server Container Host.

trans-unit.source: Log into the VM using the username and password specified during the VM creation wizard.
trans-unit.target: Log into the VM using the username and password specified during the VM creation wizard.

trans-unit.source: Once logged in you will be looking at a Windows command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Once logged in you will be looking at a Windows command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps - Start Using Containers
trans-unit.target: Next Steps - Start Using Containers

trans-unit.source: Now that you have a Windows Server 2016 system running the Windows Server Container feature jump to the following guides to begin working with Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container images.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have a Windows Server 2016 system running the Windows Server Container feature jump to the following guides to begin working with Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container images.
